meanings.def: the process of time going by
examples: The colour of the wood darkens with the passing of time.

meanings.def: the fact of something ending or of somebody dying
examples: When the government is finally brought down, no one will mourn its passing.
the passing of the old year (= on New Year’s Eve)
Many will mourn her passing (= her death, when you do not want to say this directly).
Her death marks the passing of an era.

meanings.def: the act of making something become a law
done or said when your main focus is something different
examples: He only mentioned it in passing and didn't give any details.

idioms.def: done or said when your main focus is something different
examples: He only mentioned it in passing and didn't give any details.

meanings.def: lasting only for a short period of time and then disappearing
examples: He makes only a passing reference to the theory in his book (= it is not the main subject of his book).
She bears more than a passing resemblance to (= looks very like) your sister.
This was the album that confirmed once and for all that rap music was no passing fad.
I was forced to ask passing strangers for money.
I love him more with each passing day.

meanings.def: a mark that achieves the required standard in an exam, a test, etc.
